title: Walton on Thames River Walk Route

images.title: steve / The Thames from Walton Bridge
images.caption: The Thames from Walton Bridge. This photograph was taken from the old Walton bridge looking across the new bridge. The old one is now just for cyclists and pedestrians.

images.title: Nigel Cox / River Thames at Walton-on-Thames
images.caption: River Thames at Walton-on-Thames. Viewed looking across the river from Walton-on-Thames towards the riverside houses in Shepperton.

images.title: Nigel Cox / River Thames: The swans at Walton-on-Thames
images.caption: River Thames: The swans at Walton-on-Thames. River viewed looking upstream towards Walton Bridge and Walton Marina.

images.title: David Kemp / Sunbury Lock
images.caption: Sunbury Lock. This is the older of the two locks that comprise Sunbury Lock. It dates from the mid-1850s when the present lock was constructed to replace an earlier lock situated a short distance upstream. A footbridge links this part of the lock with Sunbury Lock Ait but is not open to the public.

images.title: Motmit / CC BY-SA (https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/3.0)
images.caption: Old Lock House, Sunbury Lock, Walton-on-Thames.  View of the lock cut and the old lock house from narrow Sunbury Lock Ait

description: This walk takes you along a section of the Thames Path to Hampton Court Park. It's about a 5 mile walk to the historic palace, so 10 miles there and back. The walk starts on Walton Bridge where you can pick up the waymarked footpath and follow it north east towards the riverside park, Sunbury and the pretty Sunbury Lock where there's an old lockkeeper's house and a weir. The route continues past Hurst Park before coming to Hampton Court Bridge. Here you can cross the bridge before finishing at the impressive palace. The 16th century palace has a fascinating history having been one of Henry VIII's most favoured residences.
